{"step_by_step_thinking": "Complex fractionated atrial electrograms (CFAEs) are a type of electrical activity recorded from the heart during atrial fibrillation, a type of irregular heart rhythm. Sinus rhythm is the normal regular rhythm of the heart. The relationship between CFAEs and sinus rhythm fractionation is a topic of ongoing research. Some studies suggest that there may be a correlation, while others do not. Therefore, the relationship is not definitively established.", "answer_choice": "C. maybe"}
